introduction.description: Welcome to Api-Football! You can use our API to access all API endpoints, which can get information about Football Leagues & Cups. We have language bindings in various languages. The update frequency indicated in the documentation is given as an indication and may vary for certain competitions.

authentication.overview: We use API keys to allow access to the API. You can register a new API key in rapidapi or directly on our dashboard. The accounts on RapidAPI and on our Dashboard are dissociated, each with its own URL and API-KEY.
authentication.apiKeyInfo: Replace XxXxXxXxXxXxXxXxXxXxXxXx with your API key. The API key must be included in all API requests via the headers.

requestsHeadersCors.note: Non-GET requests or adding disallowed headers will cause errors. Some frameworks may add extra headers automaticallyâ€”these must be removed to avoid errors.

rapidapiAccount.description: All subscription information is on the RapidAPI developer dashboard, where you can see apps, API keys, analytics, and billing.
rapidapiAccount.analyticsInfo: You can view account-wide analytics or app-specific analytics (API calls, error rates, latency). Time period can be changed via the calendar icon.

headersSentAsResponseRapidAPI.server: The current version of the API proxy used by RapidAPI.
headersSentAsResponseRapidAPI.x-ratelimit-requests-limit: Number of requests allowed by your current plan before overages.
headersSentAsResponseRapidAPI.x-ratelimit-requests-remaining: Number of requests remaining before reaching the plan limit.
headersSentAsResponseRapidAPI.X-RapidAPI-Proxy-Response: Set to true if the response is generated by RapidAPI proxy, not by the origin server.

apiSportsAccount.description: If you subscribe directly on our site, you have a dedicated dashboard. It shows real-time usage, subscription details, server status, and you can test all endpoints without code.

headersSentAsResponseApiSports.x-ratelimit-requests-limit: Number of requests allocated per day according to your subscription.
headersSentAsResponseApiSports.x-ratelimit-requests-remaining: Number of remaining requests per day according to your subscription.
headersSentAsResponseApiSports.X-RateLimit-Limit: Maximum number of API calls per minute.
headersSentAsResponseApiSports.X-RateLimit-Remaining: Number of API calls remaining before reaching the per-minute limit.

logosImages.description: Calls to logos/images do not count towards the daily quota but have rate limits. It's recommended to cache these resources. The images are used only for identification purposes; all rights belong to their authors. You must ensure your use complies with relevant laws and IP frameworks.

sampleScripts.note: Replace {endpoint} with the actual endpoint (e.g., leagues, fixtures). Replace XxXxXxXxXxXxXxXxXxXxXxXx with your API-KEY. Below is a Swift (URLSession) example:
